I am pleased to see #USMCA  pass the House with strong bipartisan support.
 Idaho farmers and ranchers need fair, free trade to compete and this deal provides a level playing field. https://simpson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398832 …
After careful consideration of the evidence I voted no on #impeachment and here’s why https://simpson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398830 …

Our troops work tirelessly each and every day to promote global security and protect the American way of life, and I am proud to support a bill that supports them. #NDAA https://simpson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398829 …

Idaho farmers and ranchers feed the world and their greatest needs are a legal workforce and free trade, and this week we made tremendous progress on both issues. https://simpson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398828 …

We have real work to do and this madness should come to an end.

See my full statement regarding impeachment below: https://simpson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398820 …

Idaho is the only state in the US that has never been part of a foreign country, unless you count that both the US and Britain jointly claimed Oregon Country (which Idaho was part of) until 1846.
#IdahoDay

If all of Idaho’s mountains, hills, and gorges were ironed out flat, it would be the largest state in the Lower 48 -  yes, that includes you Texas 🏔️
#IdahoDay

Congress passed legislation in 1887 to give northern Idaho back to Washington, and another proposal in the Senate would have given southern Idaho to Nevada. However, President Grover Cleveland pocket-vetoed the bill, thanks Grover!
#IdahoDay

For all our snow loving friends - the world’s 1st ski chairlifts were created for America’s 1st destination ski resort here in Sun Valley Idaho ⛷🏂

Idaho hosts the US’s only gold-tier Dark Sky Reserve, meaning the lack of light pollution makes it possible to see the Milky Way, several planets, and more with the naked eye.
#IdahoDay

When President Abraham Lincoln signed the Idaho Territory into existence on March 4, 1863 it contained all of present-day Montana and almost all of present-day Wyoming as well.
